devaluation noun [C or U]
(MONEY)

the action of reducing the rate at which money can be exchanged for foreign money: devaluation of The devaluation of the dollar had a strong effect on the financial markets. currency devaluations

devaluation noun [C or U]
(LESS IMPORTANT)
the action of causing someone or something to be considered less valuable or important: Does staying at home as a mother just encourage the devaluation of women professionally? The existence of slavery represents a devaluation of human life.
More examplesFewer examplesthe devaluation of women's workHe argues that there has been a devaluation of a university degree.This devaluation of ageing means we prize youth above all else.
